kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT INJECTION RATE measures the total number of defects (bugs) detected for a story

operands: No. of defects tagged to all stories closed in a sprint
Total no. of stories closed in the sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect injection rate between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: FIRST TIME PASS RATE measures the percentage of tickets that pass QA first time (without stimulating a return transition or defect tagged)

formula.lhs: First time pass rate (FTPR) for a Sprint
operands: No. of issues closed in a sprint which do not have a return transition or any defects tagged
Total no. of issues closed in the sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of first time pass rate between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT DENSITY measures the total number of defects against the size of a story

operands: No. of defects tagged to all stories closed in a sprint
Total size of stories closed in the sprint

details.value: The KPI is applicable only if the estimation is being done in 'STory Points'
It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect density between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT SEEPAGE RATE measures the percentage of defects leaked from the current testing stage to the subsequent stage

operands: No. of  valid defects reported at a stage (e.g. UAT)
Total no. of defects reported in the current stage and previous stage (UAT & QA)

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lesser the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect seepage rate between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT REMOVAL EFFICIENCY gives a measure of efficiency of the development team in closing defects raised because of new functionalities within the iteration

operands: No. of defects tagged to stories in the iteration that are fixed
Total no. of defects tagged to stories in a iteration

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect removal efficiency between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT REJECTION RATE measures the effectiveness of a testing team

operands: No. of defects rejected in a sprint
Total no. of defects reported in a sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lesser the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect injection rate between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT COUNT BY PRIORITY measures number of defects for each priority defined in a project

formula.rhs: No. of defects linked to stories grouped by priority

details.value: It is calculated as ‘Count’. Lower the count, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect count by priority between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: DEFECT COUNT BY RCA measures number of defects along with the root cause of defects

formula.rhs: No. of defects linked to stories grouped by Root Cause

details.value: It is calculated as ‘Count’. Lower the count, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of defect count by RCA between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: Created vs Resolved defects gives a view of closed defects in an iteration vs planned + added defects in the iteration. The aim is to close all the defects that are in the iteration.

details.value: If the No. of defects resolved are equal to the No. of defects created in the latest sprint, the KPI is considered having a positive trend.

kpiInfo.definition: REGRESSION AUTOMATION COVERAGE measures progress of automation of regression test cases

operands: No. of regression test cases automated
Total no. of regression test cases

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of regression automation coverage between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: IN-Sprint AUTOMATION COVERAGE measures progress of automation of test cases created within the Sprint

operands: No. of in-sprint test cases automated
Total no. of in-sprint test cases created

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of in-sprint automation coverage between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints

kpiInfo.definition: UNIT TEST COVERAGE is a measurement of the amount of code that is run by unit tests - either lines, branches, or methods.

formula.lhs: The calculation is done directly in Sonarqube

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value
A progress indicator shows trend of Unit test coverage between last 2 weeks. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: SONAR VIOLATIONS highlight count of issues that exist every time a piece of code breaks a coding rule. The set of coding rules is defined through the associated Quality profile for each programming language in the project.

formula.lhs: Issues are categorized in 3 types: Bug, Vulnerability and Code Smells

details.value: All these issues are categorized into 5 type of severity: Blocker, Critical, Major, Minor, Info
A progress indicator shows trend of Unit test coverage between last 2 weeks. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: SONAR TECH DEBT explains the estimated time required to fix all maintainability Issues/ code smells

formula.lhs: It is calculated as effort to fix all Code Smells. The effort is calculated in minutes and converted to days by assuming 1 Day=8 Hours.

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Days’. Lower the days, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Sonar Tech Debt between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive.
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: CHANGE FAILURE RATE measures the proportion of builds that have failed for whatever reason over a given period of time

operands: Total number of failed Builds
Total number of Builds

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Lower the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Change Failure Rate between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 weeks
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 weeks, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: TEST EXECUTION AND PASS PERCENTAGE measures the percentage of test cases that have been executed & the percentage that have passed.

details.value: It is calculated as
No. of executed test cases out of total test cases in the latest execution of a sprint
No. of pass test cases out of executed test cases in  the latest execution of a sprint
It is calculated in ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Unit test coverage between last 2 Sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints

kpiInfo.definition: STORY COUNT measures the overall work taken in a sprint

formula.lhs: No. of stories tagged to a Sprint

kpiInfo.definition: Commitment reliability measures the percentage work completed at the end of a sprint in comparison to the total work in the sprint

operands: No. of issues or Size of issues completed
No. of issues or Size of issues committed

details.value: It is calculated as a 'Percentage'. Higher the percentage during a sprint, better forecasting can be done for future sprints
A progress indicator shows trend of Commitment reliability between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints

kpiInfo.definition: Sprint Predictability signifies how stable is a team's velocity such that it can be used in forecasting milestones in future

operands: sprint velocity of the targeted sprint.
average sprint velocity of previous 3 sprints

details.value: If previous 3 sprints are not available, then Predictability of targeted sprint will be 100
If only previous 2 sprints are available, then it is calculating average of 2 sprints
If only one previous sprint is available, then it is calculating as targeted sprint velocity divided by previous sprint velocity

kpiInfo.definition: SPRINT VELOCITY measures the rate at which a team can deliver every Sprint

formula.lhs: Sum of story points of all stories completed within a Sprint

kpiInfo.definition: SPRINT CAPACITY UTILIZATION depicts the maximum amount of time a team can commit within sprint

details.value: This KPI is calculated based on 2 parameters
Estimated Hours: It explains the total hours required to complete Sprint backlog. The capacity is defined in KnowHOW
Logged Work: The amount of time team has logged within a Sprint. It is derived as sum of all logged work against issues tagged to a Sprint in Jira

kpiInfo.definition: AVERAGE RESOLUTION TIME measures average time taken to complete an issue that could be a story or bug etc.

formula.lhs: Sum of resolution times of all issues completed in the Sprint/No. of issues completed within a sprint

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Days’. Fewer the days better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Average Resolution Time between last 2 sprints. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 sprints
*If the KPI data is not available for last 5 sprints, the Maturity level will not be shown

kpiInfo.definition: MEAN TIME TO MERGE measures the efficiency of the code review process in a team

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Hours’. Fewer the Hours better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Mean time to merge in last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 weeks

kpiInfo.definition: NUMBER OF CHECK-INS helps in measuring the transparency as well the how well the tasks have been broken down. NUMBER OF MERGE REQUESTS when looked at along with commits highlights the efficiency of the review process

details.value: It is calculated as a Count. Higher the count better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Number of Check-ins & Merge requests between last 2 days. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: CODE BUILD TIME measures the time a job takes to build the code.

details.value: It is calculated in  ‘Mins’. Lesser the time better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Code Build Time between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of 5 weeks

kpiInfo.definition: LEAD TIME is the time from the moment when the request was made by a client and placed on a board to when all work on this item is completed and the request was delivered to the client.

formula.lhs: It is calculated as the sum Ideation time, Development time & Release time

details.value: Ideation time (Intake to DOR): Time taken from issue creation to it being ready for Sprint.
Development time (DOR to DOD): Time taken from start of work on an issue to it being completed in the Sprint as per DOD.
Release time (DOD to Live): Time taken between story completion to it going live.
Each of the KPIs are calculated in 'Days' . Lower the time, better is the speed & efficiency of that phase
*Based on the configured sprints, the number of days data is considered for Lead time. So if 5 sprints are configured, total number of days considered is 5 *15days= 75 days

kpiInfo.definition: DEPLOYMENT FREQUENCY measures how often code is deployed to production

formula.rhs: It is calculated as No. of deployments done on a environment in a month

details.value: It is calculated as a 'Count'. Higher the count during a month, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of Deployment frequency between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the average of the last 5 months

kpiInfo.definition: Release Frequency highlights the number of releases done in a month

formula.rhs: Number of fix versions in JIRA for a project that have a release date falling in a particular month

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Count’. Higher the Release Frequency, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of Release Frequency between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: Cost of delay (CoD) is a prioritization framework that helps a business quantify the economic value of completing a project sooner as opposed to later.

formula.lhs: COD for a Epic or a Feature
formula.rhs: User-Business Value + Time Criticality + Risk Reduction and/or Opportunity Enablement.

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Days’. Higher the CoD for a feature or an Epic, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of CoD between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiName: Ticket Open vs Closed rate by type

kpiInfo.definition: Ticket open vs closed rate by type gives a comparison of new tickets getting raised vs number of tickets getting closed grouped by issue type during a defined period.

details.value: This can be filtered based on issue type
If the No. of tickets closed are more than the No. of tickets opened in the latest time period, the KPI is considered having a positive trend.

kpiName: Ticket Open vs Closed rate by Priority

kpiInfo.definition: Ticket open vs closed rate by priority gives a comparison of new tickets getting raised vs number of tickets getting closed grouped by priority during a defined period.

details.value: This can be filtered based on priority.
If the No. of tickets closed are more than the No. of tickets opened in the latest time period, the KPI is considered having a positive trend.

kpiName: Net Open Ticket Count by Priority

kpiInfo.definition: NET OPEN TICKET COUNT BY PRIORITY measures the overall open tickets during a defined period grouped by priority. It considers the gross open and closed count during a period and then plots the net count

details.value: Decrease in net open ticket count is considered as positive

kpiName: Net Open Ticket Count By RCA

kpiInfo.definition: NET OPEN TICKET COUNT BY RCA measures the overall open tickets during a defined period grouped by RCA. It considers the gross open and closed count during a period and then plots the net count

details.value: Decrease in net open ticket count is considered as positive

kpiInfo.definition: Net open ticket count by status measures the overall open tickets during a defined period grouped by Status. It considers the gross open and closed count during a period and then plots the net count

details.value: Decrease in net open ticket count is considered as positive

kpiInfo.definition: OPEN TICKETS AGEING BY PRIORITY groups all the open tickets based on their ageing and priority
REGRESSION AUTOMATION COVERAGE measures progress of automation of regression test cases

operands: No. of regression test cases automated
Total no. of regression test cases

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of regression automation coverage between last 2 sprints. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: UNIT TEST COVERAGE is a measurement of the amount of code that is run by unit tests - either lines, branches, or methods.

formula.lhs: The calculation is done directly in Sonarqube

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Unit test coverage between last 2 weeks. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: SONAR VIOLATIONS highlight count of issues that exist every time a piece of code breaks a coding rule. The set of coding rules is defined through the associated Quality profile for each programming language in the project.

formula.lhs: The calculation is done directly in Sonarqube.

details.value: Issues are categorized in 3 types: Bug, Vulnerability and Code Smells.
All these issues are categorized into 5 type of severity: Blocker, Critical, Major, Minor, Info.

kpiInfo.definition: SONAR TECH DEBT explains the estimated time required to fix all maintainability Issues/ code smells

formula.lhs: It is calculated as effort to fix all Code Smells. The effort is calculated in minutes and converted to days by assuming 1 Day=8 Hours.

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Days’. Lower the days, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Sonar Tech Debt between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive.
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: TEST EXECUTION AND PASS PERCENTAGE measures the percentage of test cases that have been executed & the percentage that have passed.

details.value: It is calculated as
No. of executed test cases out of total test cases in the latest execution during a day/week/month
No. of pass test cases out of executed test cases in  the latest execution during a day/week/month
It is calculated in ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
A progress indicator shows trend of Test Execution and pass percentage between last 2 days/weeks/months. An upward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: Ticket velocity measures the size of tickets (in story points) completed in a defined duration
Team Capacity is sum of capacity of all team member measured in hours during a defined period.
CODE BUILD TIME measures the time a job takes to build the code.

details.value: It is calculated in  ‘Mins’. Lesser the time better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Code Build Time between last 2 weeks. A downward trend is considered positive
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: NUMBER OF CHECK-INS helps in measuring the transparency as well the how well the tasks have been broken down.

details.value: It is calculated as a Count. Higher the count better is the ‘Speed’
A progress indicator shows trend of Number of Check-ins & Merge requests between last 2 days. An upward trend is considered positive.
Maturity of the KPI is calculated based on the latest value

kpiInfo.definition: LEAD TIME is the time from the moment when the request was made by a client and placed on a board to when all work on this item is completed and the request was delivered to the client.

formula.lhs: It is calculated as the sum following

details.value: Open to Triage: Time taken from ticket creation to it being refined & prioritized for development.
Triage to Complete: Time taken from start of work on a ticket to it being completed by team.
Complete to Live: Time taken between ticket completion to it going live.
Each of the KPIs are calculated in 'Days.

kpiInfo.definition: Release Frequency highlights the number of releases done in a month

formula.rhs: Number of fix versions in JIRA for a project that have a release date falling in a particular month

details.value: It is calculated as a ‘Count’. Higher the Release Frequency, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of Release Frequency between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive

kpiInfo.definition: Cost of delay (CoD) is a prioritization framework that helps a business quantify the economic value of completing a project sooner as opposed to later.

formula.lhs: COD for a Epic or a Feature
formula.rhs: User-Business Value + Time Criticality + Risk Reduction and/or Opportunity Enablement.

details.value: It is calculated in ‘Days’. Higher the CoD for a feature or an Epic, more valuable it is for the Business or a Project
A progress indicator shows trend of CoD between last 2 months. An upward trend is considered positive
Planned capacity is the development team's available time.
Source of this is KnowHOW

kpiInfo.definition: Work Remaining KPI illustrates the remaining work in the iteration in terms of No. of Issues/ Size of Work (in SP) and in terms of Remaining Hours required to complete pending work.

details.value: In addition, it also shows the potential delay because of all pending stories. Potential delay and predicted completion date can be seen for each issue as well
For the KPI to reflect meaningful info,
1. Update Due date on each issue
2. Update remaining estimate on each issue
3. Ensure issues are assigned to the correct person.
4. For any stories spilled, update the due date so that is falls between the active iteration.
Issues that show up in the KPI are based on the ‘Issues not completed’ list in Sprint report in Jira.
Issue count - Total no. of issues that are not completed.
Story Points - Sum of story points of all issues not completed.
Hours - Sum of remaining hours of all incomplete issues in Jira.
Issue finishing in the last two days of the iteration are marked in AMBER
Issues finishing post iteration are marked in RED
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings
Planned Work status explains the planned vs actual progress weighed in terms of issues and size of work.
For the KPI to reflect meaningful info,
Map all ‘In Progress status’ in mappings for your project.
Ensure Original Estimate & Due Date is added to all issues in a sprint.
Assignees should be kept up to date in Jira.
Completed work is based on the ‘Issues completed’ list in Sprint report in Jira.
Planned work is based on 'Due Date'.
Issue count - Total no. of issues that are completed.
Story Points - Sum of story points of all issues that are completed

In addition, the information on overlay lets the user know the delay for each issue that has been completed.The delay is calculated by comparing the time an issue took to get completed, from the time it was 'In Progress' with the 'Original Estimate' of issue.
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings
Dev Completed status explains the Dev Completed vs actual progress weighed in terms of issues and size of work.
For the KPI to reflect meaningful info,
Map all ‘In Progress status’ in mappings for your project.
Ensure Original Estimate & Dev Due Date is added to all issues in a sprint.
Assignees should be kept up to date in Jira.
Completed work is based on the ‘Issues completed’ list in Sprint report in Jira.
Planned work is based on 'Dev Due Date'.
Issue count - Total no. of issues that are completed.
Story Points - Sum of story points of all issues that are completed

In addition, the information on overlay lets the user know the delay for each issue that has been completed.The delay is calculated by comparing the time an issue took to get completed, from the time it was 'In Progress' with the 'Original Estimate' of issue.
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings
Estimate vs Actual gives a comparative view of the sum of estimated hours of all issues in an iteration as against the total time spent on these issues
Source of this KPI is Jira fields - Original Estimate and Logged Work
To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings

Issues likely to spill gives intelligence to the team about number of issues that could potentially not get completed. This prediction is based on the the Predicted Completion date i.e if Predicted completion completion date > Sprint end date for an issue, it is considered to be potential spill.

kpiLinkDetail.text: Predicted completion date logic is detailed at

details.value: Closures possible today gives intelligence to users about how many issues can be completed on a particular day of an iteration. An issue is included as a possible closure based on the calculation of Predicted completion date.

kpiLinkDetail.text: Predicted completion date logic is detailed at

details.value: Iteration commitment illustrates the scope of work committed by the team at the beginning of the iteration.
The KPI also shows the scope added and removed during the iteration. Scope is shown both in terms of issue count and size of work (Story points)
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings
Estimation Hygiene acts as an indicator to identify issues which are either not estimated and the issues which do not have logged work.
*This is just to measure the hygiene of Jira usage by a team
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings
Defect Count by RCA KPI gives a graphical representation of no. of issues by Root Cause RCA.
This KPI is very useful for retrospective meetings and it clearly illustrates how the iteration was when looked in combination to other iteration board KPIs
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings

kpiInfo.definition: Quality status as a KPI showcases the basic defect related metric that helps distinguish between story related defects, defects arising out of regression and their correlation to the complexity of work taken in the iteration

details.value: The KPI shows:
1. Linked defects to story
2. Defect Injection Rate
3. Defect Density
4. Unlinked defects
*Any defect created during the iteration duration but is not added to the iteration is not considered
Unplanned Work status keep track of the issues which doesn't have due date.
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings

Daily Closures KPI gives a graphical representation of daily progress in terms of no. of issues planned, actual no. of issues closed till the current day and the predicted daily closures for the remaining days of the iteration.
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings.
Wastage KPI gives a depiction of total time an issue was not being worked upon in the iteration by anyone in the team after moving to in progress.
Blocked time - Total time when any issue type is waiting for input from internal team or external stakeholders.
Wait time : Total time when any issue is in statuses similar to Ready for testing, ready for deployment etc.
Wastage - Sum of Blocked time and Wait time hours as mentioned in Jira of all issues in the iteration which is either block or in wait
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings
FIRST TIME PASS RATE measures the percentage of tickets that pass QA first time (without stimulating a return transition or defect tagged)
It is calculated as a ‘Percentage’. Higher the percentage, better is the ‘Quality’
First time pass rate (FTPR) = No. of issues closed in a sprint which do not have a return transition or any defects tagged / Total no. of issues closed in the sprint

formula.rhs: # of total non-regression test cases without story link
# of total defects without Story link

details.value: This KPI works only at project level. Graph shows data of the project with the latest sprint from the selected filters.
This Kpi works only on Project level.

kpiInfo.definition: Production Defects ageing KPI groups all the production defects which are not closed from those created in last 15 months in standard buckets that are  <1 Month, 1-3 Month, 3-6 Month, 6-12 Month, > 12 Month. These defects can be filtered based on 'Priority'. The KPI measures the effectiveness of Defect Backlog prioritization and is useful for Product Owner, Scrum Master and the development team
Defect count by status shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by status. The pie chart representation gives the count of defects in each status

details.value: Iteration Status KPI gives a representation of delays in the story.
This KPI gives the information of net delay of all the issues, issues causing delay and issues completed before due date.

kpiInfo.definition: Defect reopen rate measures number of defects reopened out of the total number of defects raised.
Defect count by Status shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by Status. The pie chart representation gives the count of defects in each Status
Defect count by RCA shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by status. The pie chart representation gives the count of defects in each RCA
Defect Count by Assignee shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by Assignee. The pie chart representation gives the count of defects by each Assignee
Defect Count by Priority shows the breakup of all defects within an iteration by Priority. The pie chart representation gives the count of defects in each Priority
Refinement rejection rate measures the percentage of stories rejected during refinement as compared to the overall stories discussed.
Release progress KPI explains the count of issues in To, In Progress, Done. It also gives the breakup (To, In Progress, Done) based on size (story points)

details.value: Backlog Readiness KPI compares the total size of ready Product Backlog items (PBI) against the average velocity of last five sprints to ascertain if enough backlog items are always available for the team to start development. It also calculates the average time taken for Backlog items to be ready for development.
Source of this KPI is Jira. To see the latest data, run the Jira processor from KnowHOW settings

kpiInfo.definition: Flow Distribution evaluates the amount of each kind of work (issue types) which are open in the backlog over a period of time.
Flow load indicates how many items are currently in the backlog. This KPI emphasizes on limiting work in progress to enabling a fast flow of issues

details.value: KPI for tracking moral of team members

kpiInfo.definition: Total count of issues in the Backlog with a breakup by Status.
Total count of issues in the backlog with a breakup by issue type.
Iteration readiness depicts the state of future iterations w.r.t the quality of refined Backlog
PI predictability is calculated by the sum of the actual value achieved against the planned value at the beginning of the PI
Total count of issues in the backlog with a breakup by defect type.
It gives a breakup of escaped defects by testing phase
Scope churn explain the change in the scope of sprint since the start of iteration

operands: Count of Stories added + Stories removed
Count of Stories in Initial Commitment at the time of Sprint start

kpiInfo.definition: LEAD TIME FOR CHANGE measures the velocity of software delivery.

details.value: LEAD TIME FOR CHANGE Captures the time between a code change commit and its deployable state.

kpiInfo.definition: It shows the breakup by status of issues tagged to a release. The breakup is based on both issue count and story points
It depicts the progress of each Feature in a release in terms of total count and %age completion.
Mean time to recover will be based on the Production incident tickets raised during a certain period of time.

details.value: For all the production incident tickets raised during a time period, the time between start date and closed date of the incident ticket will be calculated.
The average of all such tickets will be shown.

kpiInfo.definition: Flow load indicates how many items are currently in the backlog. This KPI emphasizes on limiting work in progress to enabling a fast flow of issues
Cycle time helps ascertain time spent on each step of the complete issue lifecycle. It is being depicted in the visualization as 3 core cycles - Intake to DOR, DOR to DOD, DOD to Live.
